articles.author: Tom Balmforth
articles.description: A previously unreported Ukrainian white paper to be presented to the EU calls for the 27-member bloc to take a more aggressive and independent position on sanctions as uncertainty hangs over Washington's future role.
articles.title: Exclusive: Ukraine pitches tougher Russia sanctions plan to EU as US wavers

articles.author: A.J. Vicens, Raphael Satter
articles.description: A hacker who breached the communications service used by former Trump national security adviser Mike Waltz earlier this month intercepted messages from a broader swathe of American officials than has previously been reported, according to a Reuters review, potentially raising the stakes of a breach that has already drawn questions about data security in the Trump administration.
articles.title: Exclusive: Hacker who breached communications app used by Trump aide stole data from across US government

articles.author: Mahmoud Issa
articles.description: Gazans living in the epicentre of the war that is now in its 20th month have no voice in the debate.
articles.title: 'Our children are dying slowly' says father searching for food in Gaza

articles.author: Saleem Ahmed
articles.description: At least four children were killed by a suicide bomber who targeted an army school bus in Pakistan's restive Balochistan province, a government official said on Wednesday.
articles.title: Blast targeting school bus kills four children in Pakistan's Balochistan

articles.author: Asif Shahzad
articles.description: Pakistan's army chief General Asim Munir is the most powerful man in the country, but his popular support has surged after the worst conflict in decades with arch-rival India, shattering criticism of interference in politics and harshly cracking down on opponents.
articles.title: Beloved strongman: Support for Pakistan army chief surges after India conflict

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Pakistan said on Wednesday it had agreed to deepen trade and investment with China, days after the end of a deadly conflict with India that Beijing urged should be resolved through dialogue.
articles.title: Pakistan, China agree to deepen trade, maintain close communication

articles.author: Emma Pinedo, Inti Landauro
articles.description: Unidentified gunmen shot dead a former Ukrainian politician on Wednesday outside a school in a wealthy suburb of Madrid, Spain's Interior Ministry said.
articles.title: Ukrainian ex-politician shot dead outside elite American school in Madrid

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Singapore Prime Minister Lawrence Wong announced a cabinet reshuffle on Wednesday after his party's election victory, with the premier retaining nine ministers as well as the finance portfolio he has held since 2021.
articles.title: Singapore PM sticks with 'experienced hands' in cabinet reshuffle

articles.author: Ben Blanchard
articles.description: China has no right to decide whether or not Taiwan is a country given it chooses its own government, Foreign Minister Lin Chia-lung said on Wednesday, adding that he would be happy to shake the hand of his Chinese opposite number in friendship.
articles.title: China can't decide whether we are a country, Taiwan foreign minister says

articles.author: Tanvi Mehta
articles.description: A professor who was jailed after making comments perceived as critical of women officers in the Indian army was ordered released on bail by the country's top court on Wednesday, his lawyer said.
articles.title: Indian professor who was jailed for comments on women military officer is released on bail
